New Records: Franz Wagner led all scorers with 27 points
The Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them
Key Match Events: Jalen Suggs' 3-pointer with 8:36 left in the third quarter ended a stretch of more than nine minutes in which the Magic did not make a field goal
Cade Cunningham finished off his triple-double by scoring the winning basket with 8.5 seconds left
LaMelo Ball scored 17 of his 31 points in the fourth quarter
Karl-Anthony Towns had 32 points, 11 rebounds and five assists and New York snapped a two-game losing streak with a win over Milwaukee
Jusuf Nurkic made the second of two free throws with 0.8 seconds left after getting fouled on an offensive rebound, lifting Phoenix to a victory over Dallas
Jayson Tatum had 33 points and nine rebounds, Payton Pritchard scored six points in overtime and Boston beat Brooklyn
Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Chet Holmgren each scored 29 points to help Oklahoma City rout Houston
Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 39 points, Scotty Pippen Jr. got his first career triple-double and Memphis beat Washington for their fourth win in five games
Anthony Edwards hit nine 3-pointers and scored 37 points to help Minnesota beat Portland
Nikola Jokic had 30 points, 14 assists and 11 rebounds for his third straight triple-double to lead Denver past Miami
LeBron James had 21 points, 13 assists and 12 rebounds in his second triple-double of the season, and the Los Angeles Lakers extended Philadelphia's miserable start with a victory
Norman Powell posted his first career double-double with 31 points and 12 rebounds, and the Los Angeles Clippers beat Sacramento for their third straight win
Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored the Lakers to win based on their recent performance
Post-Match Reflections: Franz Wagner expressed pride in his team's effort after the comeback win
The coach highlighted the victory as a crucial step toward the championship
Miscellaneous Highlights: A power outage delayed the game by 30 minutes
This was the 100th meeting between the two rival teams
The Cavaliers became the first team in NBA history to win their first 10 games and score at least 110 points in each of them
Others: Raptors sign Canada's Omoruyi to 10-day deal
